title: The London Tube Map
description: A quick win: understand The London Tube Map.

hook.text: London's Tube map is geographically wrong on purpose. It sacrifices accuracy for clarity.

buildup.text: Harry Beck, an electrical draughtsman, redesigned it in 1931 using a circuit diagram approach.

discovery.text: He straightened lines, equalized station spacing, and used color coding. Riders understood it instantly.

twist.text: His bosses rejected the first version. They thought the public needed geographic accuracy.

climax.text: When finally published, it became the template for transit maps worldwide. Every subway now copies Beck.

punchline.text: The most copied map in history is deliberately wrong.

quiz.question: What was Harry Beck's innovation for the London Tube map?
options: Using a circuit diagram style that sacrificed accuracy for clarity
